programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc).

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: "Come on down!" Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes. (cc).

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Five Oscars, including Best Picture, went to this epic drama about a Roman general who winds up an enslaved gladiator when he refuses to pledge loyalty to the emperor's power-hungry son. After years in the emperor's army, beloved leader Maximus simply wants to go home to his family. But when the dying ruler's scheming son declares himself Caesar, he orders Maximus executed. The resourceful former general promptly escapes, only to resurface later as an enslaved gladiator with revenge on his mind.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Real-life officers are followed by a camera crew, cinéma-vérité style, in a gritty up-close look at police work and the consequences of crime. The result: one of Fox's longest-running series (it premiered in March 1989). It also spawned a number of police-reality imitators. Initially filmed only in Broward County, Fla., the series went on to show officers in locations across the country. (repeat).

programme.title: Mission Impossible
programme.desc: Adaptation of the '60s TV series, with Tom Cruise as the head of a crack team of spies trying to determine who sabotaged a mission to find crucial computer information. Jon Voight, Emmanuelle Beart, Henry Czerny, Jean Reno, Ving Rhames. Brian De Palma directed.

programme.title: Now You See Me
programme.desc: A group of magicians called "The Four Horsemen" raise the awareness of an FBI agent when their performances include brazen heists of corrupt businessmen, the proceeds from which they share with their audiences.

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Five Oscars, including Best Picture, went to this epic drama about a Roman general who winds up an enslaved gladiator when he refuses to pledge loyalty to the emperor's power-hungry son. After years in the emperor's army, beloved leader Maximus simply wants to go home to his family. But when the dying ruler's scheming son declares himself Caesar, he orders Maximus executed. The resourceful former general promptly escapes, only to resurface later as an enslaved gladiator with revenge on his mind.

programme.title: Thursday Night Football: Raiders at Chiefs
programme.desc: Oakland (10-2) at Kansas City (9-3). QB Derek Carr and the resilient Raiders take a 5-0 road mark into this pivotal AFC West matchup, facing DBs Eric Berry and Marcus Peters of K.C., which allowed just 285 yards in dominating a Week 6 meeting 26-10. Alex Smith completed 19 of 22 pass attempts and Spencer Ware ran for 131 yards and a score in the Chiefs' fourth straight win in the rivalry. (live) (cc).

The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: Ride or Die
programme.desc: Fiona, facing mounting issues, contemplates Margo's offer to buy the laundromat. Meanwhile, Ian tries to deal with the fact that Mickey might be out of prison and Kev and V take matters into their own hands after Svetlana's betrayal(c).

programme.title: Tears of the Sun
programme.desc: Bruce Willis stars as a hard-bitten Navy S.E.A.L, who is sent into the heart of Africa and finds himself in conflict when he has to choose between following orders or the dictates of his conscience.

programme.title: The Affair: 303
programme.desc: Running from secrets she left behind in Paris, Juliette finds Noah an alluring prospect. But a terrifying event shatters all hope of an easy affair. Meanwhile, Noah must fight like never before to make sense of what just occurred.
When Brace's nephews come in for a visit, the guys realize that the tequila and pineapple doesn't fall far from the tree. Also, Nick mentors a new Gigolo while Bradley makes a mess with his date(c).
Brace helps Nick wrestle his boyhood dream into reality. Plus, while Bradley takes care of a woman who has faced death, Ash gets shot by his date(c).

programme.title: Ride or Die
programme.desc: Fiona, facing mounting issues, contemplates Margo's offer to buy the laundromat. Meanwhile, Ian tries to deal with the fact that Mickey might be out of prison and Kev and V take matters into their own hands after Svetlana's betrayal(c).

programme.title: The Affair: 303
programme.desc: Running from secrets she left behind in Paris, Juliette finds Noah an alluring prospect. But a terrifying event shatters all hope of an easy affair. Meanwhile, Noah must fight like never before to make sense of what just occurred.

programme.title: Tony Roberts: Motorcity Motormouth
programme.desc: Detroit native Tony T. Roberts returns to his hometown for a raucous and occasionally musical night of stand up where no topic is off limits and anything can happen.

programme.title: The Presidio
programme.desc: An ex-military policeman is now a San Francisco detective but when his former partner is killed at a military base, he takes the case. After arriving at the crime scene, he realizes he must look to his old rival for help. Stars Sean Connery, Mark Harmon and Meg Ryan.

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: In the near future, crime is patrolled by a mechanized police force and when a police droid is stolen and given new programming, he becomes the first robot with the ability to think and feel for himself but a powerful, destructive force sees him as a danger to mankind and will stop at nothing to destroy him. Stars Hugh Jackman, Sigourney Weaver and Dev Patel.

programme.title: Springsteen & I
programme.desc: A unique music documentary celebrating 40 years of rock 'n' roll icon Bruce Springsteen. Working with the filmmakers, his fans have submitted clips to create a film that reflects on their personal insights and experiences, exploring what this timeless artist means to them. Combined with the never-before-seen archival footage of Bruce's performances throughout his career, and his incredible music, this is a film for the people, by the people.

programme.title: I Am Giant: Victor Cruz
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling Victor Cruz's improbable rise to football stardom, the life shattering injury that derailed his career and his dramatic attempt at a comeback, revealing the man behind the mask, as he faces the biggest challenge of his life.

programme.title: Cold Souls
programme.desc: Paul Giamatti stars in this surreal comedy as an actor paralyzed by anxiety who decides to have his soul extracted by a high-tech company in order to alleviate his suffering but complications ensue when a mysterious soul-trafficking mule steals his soul and takes it to Russia.

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: John Travolta stars as an art forger who arranges an early release from prison so he can spend time with his dying son but is then forced to pull off one final audacious heist. Also stars Christopher Plummer.

programme.title: The Salvation
programme.desc: In the 1870s Wild West, a peaceful American settler kills his family's murderer, which unleashes the fury of a notorious gang leader who is hell bent on hunting the settler down, in this blood spattered saga of sin and redemption. Stars Eva Green.

programme.title: Rampart
programme.desc: Woody Harrelson stars as a cop who asserts his own code of justice, blurring the lines between right and wrong, but when he gets caught on tape beating a suspect, he finds himself caught in a downwards emotional spiral, amidst a corruption scandal. Also stars Sigourney Weaver, Robin Wright and Ice Cube.

programme.title: Forsaken
programme.desc: Kiefer and Donald Sutherland share the screen in this brooding western about an embittered gunslinger who attempts to make amends with his estranged father whilst their community is besieged by ruthless land-grabbers.

programme.title: Cold Souls
